SCENARIO.STOP_TIME_REQUIRED: You must enter a stop time for each stop, using a format of HH:mm:ss

SCENARIO.YOU_JUST_ADD: Add a new route to that scenario
SCENARIO.YOU_JUST_BUILT: Built the stops and shape of the route
SCENARIO.HOW_DO_TIMES_LOOK: How do the below times look?
SCENARIO.CONFIRM_NAVIGATION: Navigating away from this page will undo any changes you have made to this route. Are you sure you want to continue?

SCENARIO.ROUTE_UNKNOWN_ERROR: There was an unknown error saving your route. Please return to the routes list and try again.

ROUTE_ERRORS.MISSING_STOPS: Some stops are missing stop times

INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.AFFORDABILITY: The ratio of one month of round-trip commuting to one month of poverty-line income. If a = average one-way fare and i = yearly poverty-line income, affordability = (a*42) / (i/12).
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.AVG_SERVICE_FREQ: How often a vehicle will arrive at a particular stop for a particular route.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.COVERAGE_RATIO_STOPS_BUFFER: The percent of the urban area that is within the configured distance from stop locations.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.DISTANCE_STOPS: The average distance between stops, per route and mode.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.DWELL_TIME: The average variance in minutes of dwell time (requires observed stop times).
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.HOURS_SERVICE: The number of hours per week that the system provides service.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.JOB_ACCESS: The number of individuals who can reach a job location (destination metric) within the configured commute time. A travel-time isochrone is calculated for each job location, and the population within that area is summed. Each population-sum area is then overlaid to determine job accessibility.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.LENGTH: The sum of the total length of each route in the transit system. This indicator does not account for road or rail shared by multiple routes.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.LINES_ROADS: The ratio of transit system length to the length of the road network. This indicator accounts for multiple routes sharing the same roadway.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.LINE_NETWORK_DENSITY: An index value: the total length of the transit network in comparison to the total area of the urban area.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.NUM_MODES: Total number of different transit modes in the system.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.NUM_ROUTES: Total number of routes in the system.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.NUM_STOPS: Total number of stops in the system. Stops shared by multiple routes are counted only once.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.ON_TIME_PERF: The average variance in minutes of arrival time (requires observed stop times).
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.RATIO_SUBURBAN_LINES: The ratio of lines operating outside the urban area to the lines operating only within the urban area (based on urban boundary data provided under the Settings tab).
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.REGULARITY_HEADWAYS: The average variance in minutes of headways (requires observed stop times, which come from the uploaded GTFS data).
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.SERVICE_FREQ_WEIGHTED: Average service frequency adjusted by the number of individuals within the configured distance from stops. More frequent service in areas of high population would result in a higher metric.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.SERVICE_FREQ_WEIGHTED_LOW: Population-adjusted service frequency for only the low-income population.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.STOPS_ROUTE_LENGTH: The number of stops per kilometer of a route.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.SYSTEM_ACCESS: The percentage of the population metric 1 that is within the configured distance from stops.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.SYSTEM_ACCESS_LOW: The percentage of the population metric 2 that is within the configured distance from stops.
INDICATOR_DESCRIPTION.TIME_TRAVELED_STOPS: Average amount of time traveled between subsequent stops along a route trip.

CITYMODAL.IMPORTINSTRUCTIONS: The upload file must be a CSV file exported via this application, containing indicator data.
CITYMODAL.IMPORTBADFILE: Invalid file format. Ensure the file matches the format above and try again.

TOOLTIP.CITY: The Area of Interest boundary will be used to define a subregion of the transit system area served, such as a business district or city center.
TOOLTIP.CITY_NAME: The name that will be displayed for identifying calculations made from this feed.
TOOLTIP.REGION: This boundary should represent the total area served by the transit system.
TOOLTIP.REPRESENTATIVE_WEEKDAY: Please choose a weekday during which the system is scheduled for normal service.
TOOLTIP.REPRESENTATIVE_WEEKEND: Please choose a weekend day during which the system is scheduled for normal service.
TOOLTIP.MORNING_PEAK: Choose the beginning and end of the morning peak times.
TOOLTIP.EVENING_PEAK: Choose the beginning and end of the evening peak times.
TOOLTIP.POVERTY_LINE: The annual income for an individual at the poverty line, in local currency.
TOOLTIP.AVG_FARE: The average fare for a one-way trip on the transit system, in local currency.
TOOLTIP.DISTANCE_BUFFER: The farthest distance in meters from a station or stop that is considered accessible.
TOOLTIP.JOB_TRAVEL_TIME: The maximum commute time in minutes to be considered for job accessibility.
TOOLTIP.JOB_ARRIVE_BY_TIME: The time by which one could arrive at in order to count the jobs in that area as accessible.

SETTINGS.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Please upload two boundary files as zipped GIS Shapefiles (SHP). The application will use these boundaries to calculate accessibility and performance metrics about your GTFS data. One of the files would highlight an area of interest such as a city center, or area of job centers, for example. The second boundary should encompass the overall region served by the transit system.
SETTINGS.CONFIGURATION_DESCRIPTION: Complete configuration of the application by updating the following settings. These settings will control how the indicators will be calculated. If these settings are changed after indicator results have been calculated, please remember to click the "Finish and Calculate Indicators" button.
SETTINGS.TIME_PERIOD_CONFIG_NETWORK_ERROR: Network error loading time period configuration.
SETTINGS.DEMOGRAPHIC_DESCRIPTION: Demographic data is used to calculate indicators related to population density and destination (e.g. jobs) data. Attributes related to two population metrics and to destination counts can be mapped in this interface after the data is uploaded. An example dataset would be a GIS polygon Shapefile (SHP) with each polygon having attributes for working-age population count, low-income population count, and job count.
SETTINGS.OVERVIEW_DESCRIPTION: Welcome to the Open Transit Indicators application. This section allows administrators to configure the application so that it can calculate a variety of performance and accessibility metrics.
SETTINGS.OVERVIEW_REQUIRED_CONTENT_2: The GTFS is an open data standard for transit service data. Static data types covered by the standard include route and stop locations (for modes with fixed routes), headways and/or frequencies, operating schedules, and fare schedules. A collection of GTFS datasets may be found here: www.http://www.gtfs-data-exchange.com/. Guidance on how to build your own GTFS dataset may be found here: http://bit.ly/GTFS_Training.
SETTINGS.OVERVIEW_OPTIONAL_CONTENT: Optional inputs expand the range of indicators that can be derived through this platform. These inputs include GIS urban boundary shapefiles, a GIS demographic data shapefile, and On-time performance data generated from a GTFS realtime feed, using open-source software developed by TransitTime.
SETTINGS.OVERVIEW_CONFIGURATION_CONTENT: Edit the configuration page to ensure indicators are suited for local conditions. To begin, upload a zipped GTFS dataset.
SETTINGS.UPLOAD_GTFS_DESCRIPTION: Upload GTFS data to get started. The data should be zipped for uploading. For best results, include the shapes.txt file if it is available. While you data is uploading, you can move on to the next steps.
SETTINGS.REALTIME_DESCRIPTION: Upload the processed stop_times.txt_new file from Transitime, an on-going open-source project. With this file, can generate system on-time perforamnce indicators. For more information on this software, visit https://github.com/WorldBank-Transport/Transitime
SETTINGS.UPLOAD_DESCRIPTION: To begin, upload a zipped GTFS file. This application will first verify the validity of the data files. If valid, it will then process the data. Once the application configuration is complete, you may click the "Finish and Calculate Indicators" button. This process may take several minutes to complete, and will take place in the background. Do not restart the server until the indicator calculations are complete. You may continue using the application or leave the page and check back later.

CHANGE_PW.INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter a password of 8 characters or more.
CHANGE_PW.TEMP_PASSWORD: This action will generate a temporary password for
CHANGE_PW.INVALIDATE: This password will invalidate this user's current password. The new password will be displayed only once
CHANGE_PW.NOT_DISPLAYED: This password will not be displayed again
